title: DiSSCo openDS Term Schema
description: A schema for defining standard terms used in openDS.

@id.description: The unique identifier (handle) of the term object

@type.description: The type of the digital object, in this case a ods:Term

ods:fdoType.description: The Handle to the FDO type of the object

ods:status.description: The status of the Digital Object

ods:version.description: The version of the object, each change generates a new version. The version starts at 1 and each change will increment the version number with 1

ods:hasAgents.description: Contains all agents that are connected to the specimen. Agents that are part of a specific part of the specimen should be added there. For example, a Collector is connected to the CollectingEvent so is added in the event.

ods:hasControlledValues.description: The controlled vocabulary values that this term accepts. Each URI represents a valid value for this term.

dcterms:title.description: A Name given to the resource, in this case openDS term name

skos:prefLabel.description: The preferred lexical label for the term

skos:member.description: Indicates that this term is a member of a specific concept scheme or collection

skos:definition.description: A definition of what the term represents.
examples: A digital representation of a physical specimen

skos:note.description: A note field to capture contexts and other information around the decision.
examples: This term was discussed in projectX

skos:example.description: An example usage of the term.
examples: ods:physicalSpecimenID is used in Digital Specimen data schema

dcterms:created.description: The timestamp that the object was created in DiSSCo, following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

dcterms:modified.description: The timestamp that the object was last changed, following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

dcterms:hasVersion.description: A related resource that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the described resource.

rdfs:range.description: URIs of the classes this term ranges to or belongs to

owl:deprecated.description: Indicates whether the term is deprecated
